Would Strongly Suggest!  The Dont Starve games are one of the most interesting survival games I have played. Lets start with the stats you have to maintain. Health: one of the many things that make DST difficult for new players is maintaining health, you see , you dont regain HP over time as any character. Making the only way to heal your self is with certain healing items or food. Hunger: In DST you can make a Crockpot which allows you to make all different kinds of food to help raise or even Decrease your stats. Next is the most unique and interesting stat of DST is... Sanity your right you can go insane in this game! Your Sanity decreases at night, dusk and in other scenarios! Its important to keep your Sanity levels decent or else you might be given a visit by a Shadow Creature. These Menaces are one of the only sources of Nightmare fuel a valuable and important resource, note that they aggressive but are easy to fight. Theres a Day-Night Cycle in DST aswell and during Day its normal usually but it depends on the season. In Dusk its a warning of the upcoming Night. In Night you better have a light source because it becomes pitch-black and if your caught without light the Nightmare Monster Charlie comes and if not prepared will 1 shot you. In every season is a Boss at the Beginning Middle or End. Each of the 4 bosses cannot be approached but it comes to you at the designated time. Each boss is designed to be simular to the according season. Bearger is for Autum Bearger is a Bear mixed with a Badger and will eat all of your Winter ration if not taken care of, but drops a resource unique to itself that will aid you in Winter if used right. The Deerclops is the winter boss he will usually come around the night of day 30 or 31 and will warn you of its arrival with deep breathing to warn. He will drop his eyeball that can be used for a Over-Powered hat umbrella known as the Eye-Brella. Beware of his Huge -200 Sanity per min Aura. In the Spring bosses case the Moose-Goose is optional granted that she spawns with her ducklings at certain Moose-Goose spawning locaitons. Beware of her dis-arming honk but also after death her ducklings will become hostile and attack but also granted feathers for the next seasons use.The feathers best use is for a weapon that summons tornados but also can be used to make a fan. In Summer the Antlion is your next foe. She isnt exactly necessary to fight but is a pain if not fed with trinkets and rocks or killed. If not pleased she will created sinkholes or if underground earthquakes, warned but the screen shaking. Interesting fact the Singleplayer version of DST known as just DS (Dont Starve) the original Summer boss was Antlion but she dosent come after you like the others but beware shes a raid boss which also means shes a stronger boss.  Next and last subject is The Seasons them selves an the dangers that follow. Autum: known to be a calm passing period no real dangers. Winter: Extreme cold, if not supplied with warmth, will kill you easily. Spring: known to be a harsher passing period due to the constant rain which can cause Freezing and Insanity. Summer: Extremely Hot, the heat isnt a problem alone wild fires can happen at random causing your base to engulf in flames in not prepared with a Ice-Flingomatic (Fire exstinguishing machine.)  That was a little bit Info compared to the games size (This Review dosent include Combat Methods, Charecter guides and Cave Info)  So I hope you Purchase Dont Starve Together if you can!

I've played DST for a really long time, like a really REALLY long time. I have over 300 hours on it and it's probably my most played game in my entire steam inventory. That being said, this game is PHENOMENAL. The art style is to die for, the themes for when you get into boss fights, ambient music, how each character has their own instrument are incredible. There are so many little nuances that Klei inserts into the game that makes me revere it so highly, it's the small attention to detail in the game that makes it so fantastic.   This game has quite a bit of a learning curve. You'll start out, and try to survive (probably rather unsuccessfully) and learn about what different mobs do, what certain structures do, which ones to build, and so forth. The beauty in this game is within its learning curve. It's designed for you to learn from your mistakes in a comical world where at first nearly everything can kill you, it can almost be discouraging. This matters so much however once you reach the point where you can actually survive. The amount of reward you feel, the amount of work that's paid off is immense and it feels as though now that you've explored the game intimately enough you can really have some fun. Essentially, what I'm trying to say is that unlike other games where the player grinds to try to achieve something and feel successful, the fun for DST is experiencing and learning curve, as well as the payoff in the end. Even after you can survive, there's much more to do! There are boss fights and caves and the ruins, all things where the game continues to challenge the player.  With all this being said, hats off to you Klei. I've been with you since day 1, and you made a hell of a game.

I have many hours on this game, and for good reason! Don't Starve Together is a fantastic standalone expansion to the first game Don't Starve (also wonderful, I have both!). A fun way to test your skills on putting up your dukes against the rest of a randomly-generated world filled with monsters, magic, and your friends! Constantly being updated, the developers are very invested in this game and may be for quite a while. Servers can hold many, many people, though I do recommend a superior internet source as it may be a bit laggy otherwise. But don't worry, it's not unbearable unless you have many people on a single server. All in all, I completely recommend this game. Fun for hours with friends and even strangers, one of the best games I've seen in a long time!

I have not played this game for many hours but what i experienced was very positive, and have watched friends play this game often, and hope to start playing again soon.  I was never really interested in the original single player game but to be honest i would rather play multiplayer in most games  Huge amount of content for your money.  Don't starve together is a challenging multiplayer survival game, art work looks amazing and great fun with friends.   This game is very addictive and a amazing game experience due to the many elements they put into the making of this game.   The open world aspect of the game allows its players to explore and manipulate an ever-changing world how they like, no map is the same.  Unforgiving multiplayer strategy sandbox game where every action you make can affect your future game play.   If you die then don't worry as you come back as a ghost and then can annoy everyone around you :)  Open world, survival and multiplayer gets my vote every time :)  The price of £10:99 also Includes an extra copy of Don't Starve Together. Send it to a friend!  One of the best coop games i have played and would recommend you buy.

This game is perfect for anyone who enjoys farming, in a group setting. I never get tired of starting from the beginning, just so I can farm everything all over again! I can play with my friends while I scour the wilderness for food and supplies, and I love to see how many seasons I can survive, as I get more experience. There are definitely tricks to this trade, but playing with other people in the servers can help newcomers learn the ropes! Don't be afraid to press "Y", and type what you need into the chat; you might be surprised at how helpful your companions can be.

I have played this game more than any other game I have on Steam. For those who like collecting, building, searching, and figuring things out in a sandbox world, this is one of those definitive games of the genre. And playing with friends makes it so much more fun. Surviving seasons and monsters together is thrilling. There's such a depth and richness to the game, and it's awesome that the developers continue to improve it with tweaks and new content regularly. There's a tremendous amount of replaybility to the game. I know I'll  be playing it for a long time to come.

Very fun game to play with friends, quite challenging during winter if you haven't prepared effectively and takes a while to learn the game (DST wiki is your friend) but once you begin it's hard to stop unless your base is decimated by a random attack from an enemy. Huge variety of mods - adding extra (slightly cheating) functionality such as "pausing" the server while you or your friend take a piss or prepare to attack a boss, extra characters which are not included in the base game as well as other peculiar mods such as the 420 mod. All add to the enjoyability of this game and if you have a couple friends to play this with you will not regret this purchase. :)

-Choose Wilson -Collect food and materials -Build base near buffalo -Collect poop and make farms -Plant seeds -Make crockpot , scinece machine , alchemy engine , lightning rod and thermometer -Build ice box with gears found from tumblweed -Lots of food , even build walls to protect base -Easily survive three times the hound attacks with the help of buffalo -Kill two Koalefants and make two puffy vests -Winter comes -Just stay in base , eat food and occasionally chop some trees -I go to the bathroom -Deerclops spawns -Destroys all of my base -I come from bathroom and escape -Die of starving -I really starved in this game -Deleted the world because angry -Didn't know that rollbacks existed -Best survival game I have ever played 10/10 would happily starve again

TL;DR review: this is a 10/10 masterpiece and sits near the top of the best all-time indie and survival genres. If you don't have the game and it is on sale, buy it. If it's not on sale, it's still underpriced, and well worth the cost. I'll continue a more detailed review below.  The outstanding singeplayer "Don't Starve" is strengthened even more with the addition of multiplayer, here in the "Don't Starve Together" variation. If I were asked to name a great game that becomes even better with friends, this would probably be my top recommendation.  As you can see from the images, the art style is rather dark, yet charming. This theme remains consistent throughout all aspects of the game, combining perfectly to impress audiences of all ages and aesthetic preferences. Despite having the semblance of a nice little relaxing game to play, the game does not hold your hand, and provides minimal guidance.  You are thrown into the wilderness with many challenges and dangers to face. Don't expect to do well without a lot of trial-and-error. And even after you've figured out how to make light and avoid dying in the darkness, how to hunt, gather, farm, and cook enough food to maintain your hunger for a little while longer, the game will throw new challenges in your face that you probably will not be ready for.  The gameplay is deceptively simple -- gather supplies, build structures, craft equipment, flee from or fight monsters, and ultimately, survive. This pairs perfectly with the game's unique form of difficulty. The game does not seem so difficult until a new problem appears and you have to figure out how to solve it. When faced with that problem, your survival will be determined by a few principles: having enough knowledge of the game to deal with the problem effectively, anticipating and preparing for this problem, and either being creative enough or improvising to solve this problem. To a lesser extent, the game does have a small mechanical skillgap, but the mechanics are simple for the most part. The only real mechanical challenge will be learning how monsters move and determining when to attack, dodge, and run from them.  Ultimately, the game will push both your character and you to your limits. Even when you get lucky, you'll probably still face an exhilirating near-death experience. Otherwise you'll die and learn new things about the game, and be better prepared to face that challenge in the future.   Don't Starve is on par with a small list of masterpiece games that beat you down for your mistakes without making it feel like the game cheated you. Each mistake being preventable, your blunders truly feel like opportunities to learn how to build yourself back up later on.

Edit: Just generated a world that I couldn't find saplings or twigs in and died first night due to inablity to make light. Very rare bug, but this needs fixed. This game is definitely not easy, it'll be difficult to learn and master to kite and kill enemies. Be prepared to die a lot at the beginning, you can rollback your world 1 day if you're playing alone to prevent resetting your world or use commands.  There is 4 seasons with their own unique bosses with powerful and interesting boss specific drops. There is also raid bosses that are very difficult, they can be killed alone but will be extremely difficult at the beginning. Each session also has it's own challenges, such as overheating during summer, frog rain in spring, freezing during winter, etc. which requires you to acquire particular items in order to survive.  The gardening system (farms) are useful to have in order to grow crops which you'll require for unique dishes made using the crock pot (Don't use the basic farm, use the advanced one). crops such as the dragon fruit can be used to make one of the best source of healing in the game, but retrieving the crop you want is difficult as the fruit/veg that appears will be random and certain fruit/veg have a higher chance to appear compared to other ones making it difficult to retrieve certain fruits and vegetables you want. Once you retrieve the crop you want, I'd recommend feeding it to the bird in the cage to get that fruit/vegs seeds in order to grow it.   The combat system will be difficult to master, you have to learn to kit enemies which is moving and dodging pretty much. You get great satisfaction when you learn to kill more difficult stuff.   Each season (Autumn, Spring, Spring, Summer) has it's own difficulty, Summer and Winter being the most difficult.   Each character have their own unique perks and advantages and disadvantages which change the way you would play them in comparison to the other characters, for example (one of the characters cannot sleep, two are seen as monsters meaning neutral creatures are hostile, one can only eat meat based food only, etc.) Certain characters are much more efficient at doing another characters role, I'd recommend testing each character to see which suits your play style. (I recommend Wilson during the start to learn the game, unless you looked at guides)     You can retrieve mods that improve on the UI, provide you with a mini map, display your temperature and more. There is mods that add new characters, biomes, structure and more as well. These can be used to make the game easier or more difficult. (Be aware that mods can be out of date)  Cooking foods is certainly fun, but certain foods are much more efficient at providing health, sanity and/or hunger due to the value they provide and how much more easier and efficient they are to make. Certain foods have effects such as raising your temperature. I recommend knowing different types of foods rather than learning what's the best for restoring certain stats.   There is much more to say about how great this game is.

I've almost played 50 hours of Don't Starve Together and can safely say that I recommend it for those who like a sandbox/survival feel. The game itself is more enjoyable with a friend, but this doesn't stop you from enjoying it on your own. Working together as a team is a good thing in this game, and each season brings on new challenges and creatures, so you're always on the go strategising your next move! It's always been fun to talk about the equipment you may need or where a good position to set up camp is. Coming back to the single player aspect, You can play on your own in Don't Starve Together, just as you can in Don't Starve, and I made the misake of purchasing Don't Starve before Don't Starve Together, thinking they were essentually two different offers. They're not, so I would also recommend not purchacing Don't Starve as there's no real point. Also, the game has such a unique/beautiful art style, it definetly helps seperate the game from others that are alike in my opinion. A very well designed and thought out game. Love it.

This game is incredibly fun. There is no reason not to buy it. Here is a not-so-brief overview.  Massive open world  Lots of little (and big) things to explore  Great wiki (a big thanks to all that contributed)  Great building system  Challenging  Lots of stuff to do   Great animations  Lots of updates  Beefalo  Mobs can be so stupid it's funny ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Cons:  Can be slightly repetitive  Klei likes to make you want to cry    and I want to finish with my death chart  -Frog -Deerclops -pengull -Darkness -hound -darkness -krampus -spider worrier -deerclops -tall bird -tall bird (tried to get revenge) -darkness -and, the stupidest, most idiotic way, my own boomerang.

The Forge is also a really good time.

Don't Starve Together is a wonderful multiplayer survival game that combines a simple premise with goofy humor in an insane world.  If the basic strategy elements don't keep you invested, the absurd situations and creatures you encounter will almost certainly motivate you to want to survive another day in order to continue your exploration of the Don't Starve universe.
Best Game Ever.
Hi!  Don't starve together allows you to challenge yourself with a couple of friends. It really adds a new dimension to the original. I can only recommend it.
If you enjoyed the original and have friends to play with this game is well worth it. If you're planning to play alone though I would stick with the original as all the bosses have buffed health.

Don't Starve Together is definitely an uncompromising survival game, which will weed out the weak and those who aren't able to learn how to prepare for and adapt to the changes the seasons will bring. Yet with cooperation and planning, the game can be quite enjoyable and the seasonal events really spice things up, such as the Forge which puts 6 players in an arena against waves of enemies, each character fulfilling a different role to achieve success. The art style is fun, even cute, and the feel  or struggle of collecting sticks and stones to eventually constructing a fortress against the seasons and beasts (if you're smart, and maybe a bit lucky) with friends or just people online is rewarding.
Honestly, it's the Dark Souls of survival games.

Hello! I might not have many hours in this game compared to other ones but... ya know what??? It was fun. Very fun. Playing for the first time with your friends trying to understand what is going on. Inviting more friends to come and play together. Dying again. Usually, I get pretty pissed off when I die but in this game, its just funny. Dying of stupid ways. But atleast you know how you die and how you can escape that death :) I recommend this game to everyone who enjoys survival games (and to be honest, at first, this game can be a little spooky). That aside, all the different skins look great, it's fun to play both alone and with friends, you can tweak the world to your liking before generating it, and it's incredibly moddable too! The don't starve games are by far some of the best survival games around. The amount of thought and creativity that went into this game is incredible. There are so many details - animals that are aggressive only in their mating season, different clothing and ingestion needs per season, the vast amount of items and landscapes and craftables. If you enjoy survival games that are far more detailed than "eat, sleep, and fight" then you will love don't starve.

Don't Starve Together (DST) is one of the most unique and stylistic survival games out there. Whilst most of the crafting-survival genre tend to blend together gameplay wise, with only one or two elements seperating them from others, DST takes it in a whole new direction. Using the same gameplay and artstyle of the original game, it expands on it by including the Reign of Giants DLC and occasional special events.  With its sprite-based, drawn isometric artstyle, you'll see no end of the creative, horrifying, or creatively horrifying creatures and landscapes that this world has to offer.
Personally one of my favourite games. Difficult, but balanced survival - if you die, it's your fault.

9 / 10  These day its hard to find good companies, but Klei is the best. They actually care about their games and community, and the put so much hard work and love into this game, that even if it would be bad, i would give them good review. But the thing is, its amazing. Ive never liked survival games, because they always felt flat. Like when you had some food and water, all other stuff was just boring and all the same, there just wasnt anything to do and nothing interesting. But this games takes you into the story, you never feel bored because theres always something new behind the corner, even after 60 hours i have seen basically nothing. So much stuff, and everything looks fun and cool, drawing is amazing in this game, quite frankly, i dont even know about any cons. Its an amazing game, and with all the events, updates, and the fact that when you buy the game you get extra copy, theres nothing bad to say about it. Only one warning, this game is hard, and i mean really fucking HARD. It may be the hardest game ive played, but even though this games fuck you like your 50 year old uncle, you just want more. Its just terrific.

You start with nothing, in the wilderness, with your friends. Sooner or later you end your life, possibly surrounded by stuff you have built and invented, in the wilderness, with your friends, who are already dead or about to die.  Between those certain points, you hunt for food, buildingmaterials, firewood and more food. You also cook, invent things to cook better food and to store food, and try to fins more fuel for your inventions that help you cook. And then you die. Again. And you promise yourself never to play this stupid game again. Just one more try, and then  you'll never do it again... for real this time... really....

Brutally difficult but satisfyingly rewarding.  Don't Starve world is filled with monsters and environmental hazards that are trying their best to kill your character.  Surviving with other players is both fun and rewarding with all the shenanigans that you and your team will get into. Don't Starve Together has loot drops that you can earn or buy. All of them are just skins for exisitng items and characters and does not offer any advantage in-game wether you buy them or not. If you are new to the game, I suggest having a wikia open to help you with the crafting of items in the beginning of the game. The community is very helpful if you ever need help with what you need to do to survive and progess.  Don't Starve Together is a great game with a great art style and a rewarding progression system. Just need to get pass the difficult learning curve.

I have been aware of the Don't Starve series since its original release, yet I had never given any of the games a try until just this last month. The survival-crafting genre is probably one of my least favourite, though I have an extensive library of games related to it, but Don't Starve is one of the few I have played that genuinely gave me the "just one more day/night" mentality, something that I can't remember any other game of the genre doing for me. It has such a unique set of charming art, intuitive mechanics, challenging gameplay, and captivating air of discovery that make it an essential title to play. The multiplayer aspect of Don't Starve Together / The Forge only further extends the enjoyment and replayability of this game, as you get to share in the struggle and misery of the Don't Starve world with someone else, making for plenty of shenanigans. This game really was a pleasant surprise for me, and though it is an older series now it remains a refreshing experience even in 2018. I would give it a rating of 8.5/10, an absolutely essential gaming experience.

Bringing multiplayer to my all-time favourite survival game was one of the best ideas Klei ever had (besides making the original game in the first place). It retains the wonderfully weird, oddly bleak feel of the original game and slams it in with a bulk of new content and the ability to invite your friends to starve with you. And then you play as Willow and burn everything they make, because that's what multiplayer survival is all about: betrayal. At least, it is for me. But I'm getting off track. The point is that this game is the greatest multiplayer survival game I've ever played.  Music: 89% -- Some of the best, most unique music in a video game. Graphics: 92% -- A unique, unforgetable art style that is brilliantly drawn. Gameplay: 85% -- Excellent gameplay with great mechanics. Like insanity. And starving. Story: 73% -- The world of DST, like the original game, has some of the weirdest, most interesting lore I've seen. Difficulty: 80% -- I didn't rate it on balancing this time, because Don't Starve is meant to be hard, and this is. Enjoyment Factor: 92% -- Oh, it's so fun.  Overall: 85.16% -- The greatest multiplayer survival game, in my humble opinion.

Don't Starve Together is an even harsher environment than single player Don't Starve, but when you finally get people to play with you it's extremely rewarding. I've been putting it off for years from owning it because I couldn't get anyone to play with me, but it turns out the community is for the most part welcoming and friendly if you just hop in. I wish there were single player scaling (or any amount of player/party size scaling), but otherwise the additions from the base game are welcoming challenges that are fun and enjoyable and difficult as hell.

If you have friends that know what they are doing and have good internet or can host a stable server, it is fun. Playing on random servers can also be fun, but since progress gets deleted after like a day on some servers, it can feel like a waste of time. The events and new character updates that have been coming out make the gameplay a bit more refreshing.

Short history: Don't Starve Together is somewhat of a sequel to Don't Starve, and features the highly requested multiplayer mechanics. It was originally scheduled to come out in Summer 2014. There are three game modes: Survival, Wilderness, and Endless. Additional game modes are possible with the use of Mods.   Pros: 1. Can take the time away really fast 2. Can relief stress as well 3. Really fun to play with friends 4. Cheap price  5. A fun community 6. A lot of cheap customization 7. A lot of events 8. In game history    Cons: 1. Little sense of reward or accomplishment  Rating from 1-10 9-9.5   Recommendations: 1. Support the developer, buying DLCs 2. Always play with a friend!  Your boy Gadev! Take care.

So i think i have almost 200 hours in on the game. and i have about 150 in on dont starve. theyre both great games. if you love survival games and working with others to build and survive trhis game is for you. a lot of people pass this game off fbecause of its art style and say that makes it a bad game. which it doesn't. The art style is a nice twist in my opinion and i personally like it. if you dont then thats just your preference. The game its self is solid. you'll enjoy not knowing how to build anything and no tutorial or tips or what your even doing. its all a big learning experience by trial and error. which adds to the fun of the game and makes you feel accomplished when you figure things out. The crafting system is actually well done. though youre not told what does what the crafting is solid. every craftable item tells you exactly what items it takes to craft the item you want its just a matter of finding where and how to get the material needed.   The bad thing about dont starve together ive found is the community unfortunately. a lot of people are picky. if you set certain settings in your world and make some freinds while playing and they dont like it, theyll most likely get mad at you, tell you your trash and then unfriend you on steam. Most of the community hve been playing this game for some time and are not noob friendly people. I would reccomend making your own private server first and learning the ropes then after you learn some things make a public server or hop into one and lthen ask for tips from people. if you go into it knowing nothing people will get very mad.   other than that the game is great. for what it is id give it a 9 out of 10. its a definite buy if you like this style of game.

Bought this game to play with my brother thinking it would be a good deal but found it was an amazing deal when i realised you didnt need to buy two copies as it gave you a second one anyway.  On a laptop (not a high end gaming one) it didnt respond for a couple of minutes when loading the game, joining a game, or hosting a game. But, once it was loaded the game played flawlessly. Even on bad wifi, you can still play offline by playing LAN if you wish to play with others or if you want to play alone you could play in the middle of the sahara dessert if you wished.  The game does not push microtransactions upon the player, and microtransactions wont give players unfair advantages as they are purely cosmetic as far as i can tell.  Overall i would recommend this game to anyone who enjoys playing on public servers but i would really suggest gifting the second copy to someone you think would be interested because while it is more than entertaining playing online it is ten times better with friends.

[Introduction] Don't starve together (And Don't Starve) is hands down, one of the best games I have played. I've been with Don't starve since the beginning with early access, it was the second game I bought on steam so I've always loved this game. But this game is 100% worth 15$ it's fun with friend, or without. I do recomend going into this game blind, maybe watch a video that lets you understand some of the mechanics but try to go in unspoiled.  [Gameplay Overview] Don't Starve Together is a permadeath multiplayer game that has you balance between health, hunger, and sanity and trying to survive as long as possible aswell as acheiving goals. The gameplay is fun and challenging as you have to learn everything from experience, I remeber the first time playing don't starve game and knowing nothing about it, from the first [spoiler] hound attack,[/spoiler] all the way to fighting [spoiler]deerclops[/spoiler] it was horrifying but I learned from those expeirences and learned how to deal with them, this has been improved on in Don't Starve together as you can experience the game with friends! If you find the game too hard you can increase the ammount of food and resources and decrease the ammount of enemies as the world is fully customisable, you can increase the ammount of enemies to lots, or make the world always dark.   [Art Style] The art-style is one of the best I've ever seen, it captures the mood of the game so well and is beautifully animated serious props to Klei as the art-style is what seperates this game from all those other early access survival games.  [Pros] -This game has a great art style, and overhaul theme to it. As you slowly go insane you seen halucinations, hear voice, and slowly watch the world distort as you are plunged into darkness -The game is hard, which I like hard, I like a challenge other people may not like this but I personally love a challenge   [Cons] -Game can get boring without friends, but really depends on the person -Game can get repetitive after you play it for long periods of time   [Final Thoughts] This game has a tone of replayability as there is lots to explore, and even a workshop that has tons of content that includes character mods, new weapons, and even DLC's that have been ported from Don't Starve Standalone. I've gotten over 250 hours of enjoyment fo $15 I'd says a solid 10/10

Don't Starve Together is a great multiplayer game. Simply put, it is Don't Starve with all its DLC's in multiplayer. This game provides constant challenges for you to overcome, from the harshness of the different seasons, to the unique enemies and bosses to fight. It's pretty hard to ever feel like your not on the brink of failure. More people surviving does mean it's easier to collect resources, but food is king in this game and feeding more mouths keeps the game's challenge well alive. All together, you get a unique and difficult survival game with a great dark cartoony artstyle made better with your friends.

Don't starve together is the best survival game I've played however, I won't try to spoil too much. You can play alone or play with friends, this game can be difficult for new players though. There are the basic four seasons, along with many different landscapes to explore. Anything could happen next in this game.

Well, putting aside the fact, that I have yet to get through winter...  I played this with a friend of mine and I need to say, that difficulty level (or perhaps, burden of knowledge necessary here) is sometimes through the roof. One bad move, one too brave attempt, one lacking ingredient... And you are done, just go and start again.  And you will - game is constantly getting polished, new events take place and it's usually fun. Usually, because X attempt at getting through X season might be getting... Perhaps not boring, but a little bit tiring? I would also recommend playing with more, than 2 people, the more the merrier and easier in general sense.  Overall it was a very positive experience and one that can be easily recommended.

To get to the point, I'd highly recommend Dont Starve Together to anyone who loves playing survival games with their friends  When I first got the original Dont Starve years ago, it was by far my favourite game I owned. Since I didn't have a steam account at that time, I purchased it on my brothers account. Once Klei released Dont starve together, I was hooked. It is updated a good amount of times a year, and has a unique artstyle I love. Dont Starve Together is a amazing survival game to play with your friends, and even supports mods to create your own experience. It has events every once in a while, to add some spice to the play style of the game. Even if you dont want to play co-op, there are many different options to change how you play including pvp to allow a more competitive playstyle. Dont Starve and Dont Starve together are an experience that I beleive most people would enjoy, and ever since Dont Starve Together was released in 2016, I am stilled not bored of it, and play it with all my friends.
This game is really fun to play with friends or strangers, I think it's really good.

Everything you loved and hated about the first game, you are now able to share with your friends. Don't Starve Together is one of the best action/survival games I have ever played. Now you and friends can work at trying to stay alive together.  I would recommend this game to everyone.

A great game to spend time together with friends. Before you even realised, you may have spent hours in the game, enduring the different seasons with different kind of dangers. This game might looks simple, yet it requires you to learn and search for guides to actually live through the hardship which is why I suggest the game.

Compared to the regular Don't Starve the multiplayer version delivers a more challenging experience. Everyone needs to gather way more resources, communicate with each other and team up to withstand dangerous situations. A larger group has a better chance in defeating monsters but in the same time requires a lot more food to survive which balances the gameplay pretty well. All the characters have unique characteristics which can deliver huge benefits for the team or set them up for more trouble. For example Webbers spider nest can be a good source of silk and meat but after a few cycles there is a chance that it will spawn the Spider Queen. Everyone also gets a penalty in the form of a constant sanity drain if a member of the group died and is floating around as a ghost. The playerbase is usually friendly but if you join a server that is about to hit the winter season you will come across the rule of limited trust and might not get directions to the main base. This might sound a bit hostile but is just a little insurance against people who jump into a server and decide to destroy everything you and your team worked hard on. The best thing you can do is to gather some experience in single player, send the extra copy of Don't Starve Together to one of your Steam friends and jump with him / her into a private server. This way you will avoid trolls and in the same time learn about the new content that wasn't available in the classic game.

Welcome to Honex, a division of Honesco and a part of the Hexagon Group. This is it! Wow. Wow. We know that you, as a bee, have worked your whole life to get to the point where you can work for your whole life. Honey begins when our valiant Pollen Jocks bring the nectar to the hive. Our top-secret formula is automatically color-corrected, scent-adjusted and bubble-contoured into this soothing sweet syrup with its distinctive golden glow you know as... Honey! - That girl was hot. - She's my cousin! - She is? - Yes, we're all cousins. - Right. You're right. - At Honex, we constantly strive to improve every aspect of bee existence. Wait a second. Oheck it out. - Hey, those are Pollen Jocks! - Wow. I've never seen them this close. They know what it's like outside the hive. DST is a great time-consuming game, which is a compliment. It is very flexible and entertaining with unique style that will certainly get attention of new players. When you start, you want to know it all, and when you do, there is some event or update, so this adventure never ends. A wonderful world that does not burden you with quests, just an endless cycle of creating and exploring new things. It also requires a massive knowledge of game mechanics to survive and move on.  Playing with friends is a lot of fun because everyone can pick a grotesque version of themselves as their character.
honestly i had fun playing this game with friends but with workshop stuff the game gets pretty stale fast

Lots of challenging but fair fun! The game follows three simple mechanics of Hunger, Sanity and health that all need to be monitored and kept up. The game delivers a challenging start to new players but this can be counteracted with the ability to increase and decrease certain aspects of the game world such as being able to increase the amount of food drops to monsters. The game feels rewarding after learning how to kill a new monster or surviving a new season and finally getting past the last milestone that you and your friends. The game falls short on teaching the player new stuff but that only drives players to learn for them self without a set by set guide on how to play. Playing with groups of friends feels rewarding and safe but also brings the new problem of keeping everyone fed.   Over all I think the game is well worth the purchase as long as you have people to play with. If you don't I recommend playing the first game.

At first I wasn't sure if this game would really be worth it seeing I already had Don't starve and all the expansions that come with... however....  This game stands alone quite well, regardless of whether you're playing by yourself or with a friend you coerced into playing this game through constant pressure and the offer of a free copy. But I digress. This game despite the lack of SW content provides what is in my opinion a much more robust version of RoG (and more) that truly provides a challenge to those playing alone or in a large group of inexperienced players. There is frankly a lot more to do in this game than even Don't Starve single player with RoG installed that is refreshing after playing over 150 hours of the other game feeling like you've run out of things to do unless you link to SW but that's a whole 'nother story.   If you enjoy Don't starve singleplayer or somewhat challenging survival games that you can really dig into I'd say this is a great choice and worth the extra money. Also the skins are really cool. Especially for items.

Don't starve is one of my favourite games of all time, and when the co-op came out, I got it basically right away. A lot of games I end up forgetting about and walking away, but dst isn't one of those. I can come back again and again, and still have as much fun as the time before each time. And if I get bored, the game continues to update and bring in special events and minigames. The community is also really good, and there are heaps of useful mods around that work in co-op mode perfectly. I've bought this game for numerous people, and would recommend it to anyone looking for a fun game to pass the time, or something to go all completionist on it and find everything. It's a great game and I think everyone could enjoy it for different reasons if they tried, and it's great fun playing with friends. I also really like the games artwork and unlimited possibilities. It's great fun, buy it.

If you like Don't Starve, and you have friends, get Don't Starve Together or you're wasting your life. Don't Starve works excellently as a singleplayer game but something about playing it with other people can make the game significantly more fun.  ATTENTION: DON'T MAKE THE MISTAKE OF THINKING THAT HAVING MORE PEOPLE WILL MAKE THE GAME EASIER It doesn't get easier and in fact gets to be much harder in many ways. Sure you can have two things being done at once, and fight together, but you also need to worry about 2 sanity meters, 2 hunger meters, 2 health meters, and getting both people equiped for fights as you can't just equip one person for a fight. Having more people means you get to do stuff faster but have equally more stuff to do. Also be careful as due to the fact that you are now going through materials faster you're going to be chopping a lot more trees down and the Keeper of the Forest will not like you for that.  This game gets an easy 9.5/10

Don't Starve Together is a sequel/expansion to Don't Starve. As such, it comes with lots of small improvements to the original game. However, having played both versions, the only real game-changing difference this iteration has is its titular multiplayer feature. It's a great game to play with friends, and it's brought countless hours of fun in both the gameplay itself and the interactions which occur as a result of it. However, this game lacks the adventure mode of the original, which makes the gamplay kind of repetitive and doesn't give players an end goal to work towards, which might iscourage some people. If you're okay with the Minecraft-esque objective of simply "stay alive and get good", this game has a similar approach to progression. Bottom line is, this is a good game, but it's not a substitute to the original Don't Starve experience. I prefer the original as far as gameplay goes, but if you have some friends who also like the game, the ability to play and interact with them is well worth the price of admission.

A very old school challenge, this game does not pull its punches with anyone.  In the easiest mode you and friends struggle for survival against starvation, heat, cold, and hostile creatures.  Truly a fitting man vs nature achitype.  However on argueably the hardest difficulty, not only do you have to survive nature, but also the players you may have once called allies.  An incredibly addicting game, and a dev team still dedicated to updating it, Don't Starve Together is worth its cost 3 times over.

I've loved the Don't Starve games since they first came out orignally in 2012. Since then, i've bought a copy of each, all I would recommend! Me and my friend both bought our own copies even if you can gift a friend it for free, more support to the devs, they clearly care about their work!   The Klei team as put so much love and effort into these games, the art style is unique and interesting, the gameplay lasts hours. Once Don't Starve Together came out, I needed to have it, and I finally do. I play tons with my close friend and it's become an often thing for us since we don't see each other much besides online. She was new to the game, and had never heard of Don't Starve, so I thought I'd introduce her too it. She loves it, and it runs smoothly on her (Trash, Potato, it's b a d) "computer". Both of us agree that it's a great game, the story is interesting, the art is wonderful, and whole game is honestly so different and fun. I'm normally nervous to play co-op games since I'm mostly bad at them, but for once i'm the player who teaches instead of dies constantly! The events are a new fun twist and are extremely challening but fun as well.  The point is, if you're looking for a new and unique, challenging experience with your friends, this is the game for you!  A little fun add on, we're addicted, we freak out whenever something new happens, you have no idea how loud the gasps of seeing a meese/geese land right next to us on the first day of spring were. Our little base is going well, besides almost burning it down... she has a great time yelling "BURN" with willow and then laughing like a mad man, as she plays as her (can't blame her). I have a problem with picking roses, I see one, it's mine, I don't care about the health I loose. She has a problem with rocks, she must mine a l l the rocks. I can't say we without it seeming like i'm talking about webber since I play as him, it's funny though when it does happen. By the time we're done playing for the day or night, our throats are sore from laughing and screaming, it's finally nice to have a multiplayer game we can play together!

I honestly really don't like survival games. Never find them very fun. That being said, this game is awesome! Playing with friends is a blast, you aren't expected to have a wiki nearby to know how to make anything (all the recipes show you exactly what you need on a bar on the left), and dying is never as completely crushing as in other survival games. After playing 26 hours of this game with my friends, I took the plunge and just bought the singleplayer version to be able to play this great game on my own. The art style is so unique and charming, with a soundtrack that just matches everything perfectly, I don't see myself getting bored of this game anytime soon. Oh and it's got a very active and fantastic modding community too, constantly keeping things fresh and interesting!

Don't Starve Together the second installment to the Don't Starve Saga,  it’s a Wilderness based Survival game that is full of science and Magic. This is technically the multiplayer version of Don't Starve ROG  but with the updates over the years it has changed to its own game there is lots to look forward to in this game, and it is best played with friends There are tons of epic bosses to fight in Creative interesting mods the art style is very eerie and creepy giving a Tim Burton look there is quite a bit of lore put into the game giving the game pretty much a sequel to the first they're very fun events that let's us take a break from the Wilderness base Survival game such as the forge and Gorge which are exciting to play other events which are typically based around winter autumn and Chinese New Year are lot of fun, and add cool things to the game,  Skins are also a very fun part of the game giving the player something to actually work for something to collect the Developers put alot of work into the artwork for the skins and game itself seems the developers care a lot about this game as should any person who plays it I have been playing for 4 years if you are into survival games I definitely recommend this is the number 1# Survival game it has so much to do, And when playing as a job for everyone, it's a great way to make new friends and the game is constantly being updated with new content.   Rate:★★★★★

Don't Starve was the first game i have ever bought on Steam. Now when i look to this game i feel like everybody knows it, so its hard to explain the game but i will try my best.  Don't Starve is a game where you will try to survive and its not easy because everything in the world will try to kill you. You will fight monsters, try to manage your food so you don't starve later, collect materials to craft better gear and gadgets, and try to survive in harsh environments like winter season.   You will starve, you will freeze and a psycho deer cyclops will destroy your hard earned home but Don't Starve is good because of these challenges, at first you will fail but you will try different strategies and will learn at the end. If you still didn't try this game i suggest trying it, One of the best Co op games you will find on Steam.

This is a spectacular game. I've played since beta. The only complaints I have is that the internet and ping at my house is terrible, and yet I can't play the events even solo without intense lag. This would be fine during last year's forge, which I didn't favor much, but this year is different. This year (2018) is the Gorge Event. I'd love a few things to change about the game that I will include in the following list. -Each event you get to pick a free character and all their items, but only one ( I'd really like Winnona, this event is her only skin of her's I like and I feel it would make the whole community feel more loved if they got to pick a free skin of their choice to be able to remember the event every time they played) - The event ( now that there is a leveling system) would be optional to play at anytime, without the chests for leveling, but still gaining xp, to show what events you've played and be a nice reward for a new system of all year, all events. - I know this is a lot, and I'm only a single person reviewing, but I really like the farming mechanic and the alternate ways for cooking and think you should add them to the hamlet dlc for the original game.   General Ideas ( not as important as the other recommendations) -add claiming territory in pvp servers - maybe make it so if you get a common item in a regular chest you get 2 or so, making the trade inn more of a common thing to use instead of just people buying commons hoping for a more rare item to sell back on the market. - Tree house villages would be cool - more amazing puns, I loved the Prime-Ape in SW - You should add a demo/Free trial version so more people can expierience the game -not sure if i spelled that right - You should add events where people submit fan art of each character and the most popular ones get added as skins   In general this is fantastic, it would be cool if you considered some of the ideas in my first recommendations, but all in all don't trouble yourselves too much, you have made such a great masterpiece and I would hate to pressure you to change it or stress any of you at Klei out, Have a nice rest of the summer and enjoy it while you can. Good Luck!! :)

Lots of fun.  The atmosphere in this game is quite unique and very well made.  While a lot of basic stuff (like crafting, some cooking recipies, gathering of Ressources like wood, stone, flint, ...) in the game is totally intuitive other things do require regular visits to a WIKI or some hardcore search-engine usage.  The characters all have their own advantages and disadvantages so they have to be played differently and I do recommend to use a mix of them when playing coop.   Don't Starve Together can be played alone, but the balancing has been adjusted for multiplayer although a collection of mods (for readjusting the balancing once more) can be used should you wish to play this version alone.  Fighting is easier for the host (especially against bosses) since latency issues can cause other players to recieve hits they would otherwise easily avoid. Avoiding hits is essential in boss fights so that can be quite a serious problem. Buuuut you might argue that bossfights are supposed to be difficult and they are still managable, even with that problem.   I love how many adjustable options there are for setting up a new world, like the abundance of Ressources, Enemy Spawnrates, Eventtimers, et cetera. New worlds can be made quite player-friendly for easy long time survival or extremely hostile for a bigger challenge and everything in between.

Best survival game.   Don't Starve Together is the "sequel" to Don't Starve, which is already an amazing game. Don't Starve Together has unique Tim Burton style graphics and completely unique from any other game. This has to be the best survival game out there for a lot of reasons, but the main reasons are its ability to keep you going. You can't just stand around; you have to keep moving, collecting resources and food, and preparing for Winter if it's Autumn. To continue on, it becomes addicting and challenging real fast. Some people say this game is awful and one of the reasons is that there is no tutorial. Well, guess what bucko? Minecraft doesn't have a tutorial either. Tutorials aren't always necessary. Last, of all, the game has a combat system of prediction and strategy. Each monster and animal have their own way of defeating them which makes combat different for each thing you fight. You noticed the "Together" in Don't Starve Together right? Well, this game is multiplayer, meaning you can play singleplayer or private multiplayer with friends, or go on a public server alone or with friends. You need a lot of practice with the game and it's not easy for newbies, but once you learn via online or friends who are already great at the game, you'll find that Don't Starve Together is a great mix of survival and fun.

After 50 hours of gameplay i think i am ready to give a review for this game,  First of all i need to say the graphics and the gameplay are extremely beautiful and unique. The difficulty of this game is nice too, its very hard in the beginning and later when you learn the basics of this game you will find stuff much easier. graphics 9.5/10  The events are very good thing to spend time on, it requires time, speed and teamwork to achieve the best results. For now i am playing "The Gorge" Event and i need to say it is very hard but i love it! You never get bored by the content of the game because there is a lot of stuff you can learn. I hardly learned anything without the FanWIKI of DST, the game doesnt explain you the mechanics or has any tutorial for you. It just throws you in the wilderness and you need to find out how to survive. It can take you many games until you know what to do. Content 9/10  The multiplayer is very fun, you can play with your friends and join a server with up to 64 people! You can adjust the server with everything e.g How many mobs spawn,how long is a season,how big is the map etc. You can also add mobs to make your gameplay much easier like health bars, map huds and many more! I actually played this game for 4-5 days straight without getting bored. Fun 9/10  And the last thing is the price, i believe that the price is very good and if its on sale...well you gotta buy it 100% . Also you dont need to buy Dont starve and dont starve together cause the single player version comes with multiplayer (unless buying for a friend too). Price 9/10  I believe this game is totally worth it if your are a fan of survival games with hard difficulty, i've been looking for this kind of game for ages and i dont regret the price that i payed for. the price is totally equal with the content  Avarage Mark: 9.5/10 - Matt Approves

It's a Lovely Game!  1) Good for people that love challanges.This game will put everything that you have to the test. 2) A lot of cosmetics and vanity items, that will make you stand out. ( you can equip the unlocked clothing on any character you want, there are no restrictions). 3) Don't worry if you don't have somebody specific to fill in the "Together" part of the game; there are otions for you both host and join other players game. 4) Very rewarding and interesting Events that add new content to the game. 5) You get 4 "Gift Boxes" that you can exchange in survival mode for cosmetics and vanity items; this limit recharges weekly (there is no such limit for Event Chests). And if you happen to get bored of your current collection exchange some to get new ones, you can even trade the mto other players.Also Event specific cosmetic and vanity items can be turned into "Spools" which you can use to craft exactly what you want. 6) Enjoy~ :D

Don't Starve Together is an absolutely amazing game to play alone or with friends. With all the survival co-op games that are flooding the market, Don't Starve give a nice fresh breath of air to the genre. The game runs very well even on lower-end computers due to the art style and general design of the game. Below are some key qualities that make me love this game.  [h1][b]Random world generation[/b][/h1]  Every time you start a new game, the world will be randomly generated. You can edit the settings on how the world should be and what it should feature (see next point regarding this). This results in every world being unique and you can experiment with different play styles.  [h1][b]Customizable world[/b][/h1]  There is an absolutely amazing modding comunity for Don't Starve Together, but more importantly, every world you start is fully customizable in what it should feature. Here you can specify if there should be more of a type of creature, like rabbits, for example, to be able to gather more food, or less of a type of monster, like less or no hound attacks if you are struggling to survive. You can also adjust what season you start at, how long the days or nights are, the frequency of thunderstorms and many more.  [h1][b]Unique setting and eerie atmosphere[/b][/h1]  As mentioned earlier, the art style is very different to what we have nowadays with games. The story and setting of the game are shrouded in mystery and new-comers to the game will be scared of the monsters and how to fight them. The game mechanics of the darkness, sanity and seasons are fun ways of forcing the player to always do something and not just hide in a base and try to survive. You must be proactive in this game and learn to utilize the different resources, creatures and more importantly, sanity.  [h1][b]Free events[/b][/h1]  Right now The Gorge event is running which came completely free to the owners of the game. This is my first event and it is fun. It feels as a sort of 'big' mini-game, where you play in a completely different setting with other mechanics as the main game, keeping things fresh and giving the players opportunities to get new and wonderful cosmetics.  [h1][b]Conclussion[/b][/h1]  I haven't played this game for as long as I have wanted to, but it is an absolute blast to play. Every world feels unique and it is fun to always try new ways of playing. Definitely get this game, it is worth it for the full price which isn't that expensive anyways!

Hi people. This review is dedicated to Don't Starve Together. In this game I've been playing for more than 200 hours, and what can I say about this game? This is a multiplayer with unusual graphics and gameplay. After a few hours of playing, you will understand that everything is not so simple, today you are going to chop down a tree, tomorrow the tree is chopping you off. This game is designed to play with friends, because if you decide to go to the server, you will understand that there are either noobs or players who in every way want to spoil the game. So it's better to play with a good company. Personally, it's difficult for me to play with my friends, because they often like to have fun, because of this all problems turn into laughter, and later into the death of the whole team. I hope you are luckier than me. Have a good game, and a little luck!!!

This is a game, I cannot, no matter how busy, no matter what's going on, I cannot stay away from long, I truly enjoy it and consider it one of the top buys on steam. Typically I am a graphics guy. I love (unlike a lot of gamers) the big triple titles. Needless to say, this is not my typical cup of tea. However, this game has depth like you won't believe. Just when you think you found the bottom of the rabbit hole you will figure out more you can do. I love the limitless nature. The freedom to go deep, or just run around and have fun. This game is insanely good. There's a huge learning curve (many thinhgs to master) but it's simple to pick up. I've played this game for hours with my girlfriend and it's amazing! I love this game, my girlfriend and I play it a lot together it's humorous in the sense that you can do stupid or funny things in game, like acciidentally burning your base down, or engaging a strong monster when you're not well equipped. I just love this game! Personally I see no flaws, as you can mod if you wish, or even tamper with the world settings to increase or decrease the abundance of basically everything. 10/10 for me.

Find server. Pick random, get Willow, complain about it for a bit. Greet new friends and get shown the base. See other Willow. "hey guys willow is my fav character" "Oh Charlie no, a genuine Willow main..." Told to stay at home w/ other Willow while they find resources to make equipment for us. Other Willow starts acting toxic towards me. "OMG WHY DID YOU PICK WILLOW ONLY I MAY PICK WILLOW" Several days pass, all of us are well equipped, although I got swarmed by tons of killer bees, and we have no healing items so I stayed at base. Along with the other Willow. Hatch plan. Other Willow is extremely toxic towards all of us, but for some reason nobody voted her off yet. Until... I set fire to the Alchemy Engine, the Crock Pot, and several chests. Blame it on other Willow. "My Codex Umbra, what are you doing, other Willow?!" "WTF I DIDNT DO THAT" Fire engulfs base. Die in fire on purpose; victim card always works "Other Willow set fire to the entire base!" "OMG NO I DIDN'T!!!! LIER!!!" We votekick her off, then rollback,  10/10, would blame someone for a fire to votekick them off again.

上手难度比较大的一款游戏。如果新手能一开始就在被老玩家的带领下熟悉这个荒诞世界的话是一件及其美妙的一件事情。 社区提供了海量的mod，能够为不同玩家提供优质的体验。 较为开放的游戏风格，可以让更多的玩家参与其中。无论是喜欢战斗的战斗党，还是喜欢建筑几何的建筑师，亦或是喜欢探险的探险家都能在这个世界里得到满足。 这是一款典型的男女老少都适合的游戏 奇特的画风与设定也是吸引我的一个原因 当然，这款游戏十分适合男友带着不会玩游戏的女友去逐步探索（当然你需要一个女朋友），可以解决异地恋。  It is an obviously difficult game for beginnners. However, with an old guy's leading, the learning process would be wonderful.  The community includes large number of mods, which provide high quality experiece. An open world makes more people to join in. No matter who you are, whether you are an architect or an exploer, you will definitely get satisfied. A typical game for all ages !  Peculiar paintings attract me ! Of course, you can play this with your GF (by the way you should have a GF). Can solve the problem in long-distance relationship !!!

Ive met some great people on this game, some pretty horrible people to. Ive traveled to the depths of every cave, slain every boss, made hundreds of bases, killed thousands of things, including other players. Yet I still find a way to get up to some antics on every server. Ever tried raising a beefallo in the middle of the summer with extremly low resources? Ever destroyed an entire server by spawning in a million tentacles with magical books? Ever hatched thirty tallbird eggs and then watching them all fight to the death? You can go on a server and eat food, do some emotes, make some tools and plant some grass. But thats not capturing the spirit of the game, were together damnit. You can get a crowd of people to all fight a giant bug in the middle of the desert, you can discover an ancient civilization underground and fight a giant skeleton monster. You can forge giant megabases that span entire biomes. With more people you can do whatever you want in this game twice as fast, and make it twice as fun. And if your bored just hop on a server and burn down the main base or something I dont really care. 10/10, dont forget all the events and stuff to!
It's all fun and games until someone has a fire staff and your right next to a tree.

Every run I do always ends in me dying from the same dumb thing in winter (e.g. McTusk, 3rd wave hounds or running out of food). The longest I've survived is day 26-ish and  I've never experienced spring legitimately. This game is very hard and has pema-death (kind of) and I'm going to give this a 85 out of 100 on the difficulty scale and is as hard as driving a semi-truck with the tightest clutch in the world while eating ass.

first off, to get this out of the way, the only thing that I dislike about this game is the death/respawn system.   other than that, it's fun (more fun with friends obviously).    you feel rewarded by experimenting and exploring.   setting up a base camp is quite fun.  trying to dodge bees, tree monsters, ravenous dogs, and mad beefalo while gathering materials...not quite as fun.   the enemies are super unforgiving and hyper aggressive when you di*k with them.  and sometimes you dont even have to do that.  theyre just there....waiting...watching...lurking amoungst the shadows.   but again, the death system is more of a pain/punishment than anything in MP.  and in a world like DST's world...you will die in some bullsh*t ways...leaving you angerily muttering, "are you fuc*ing serious".  when you do die, get ready to become a major burden on everyones shoulders if youre playing with others.  o and while youre waiting, you can float around as a ghost being a constant reminder to your friends that you suck.

I just downloaded it and played 50 minutes straight. I can say it's worth investing on, really. However, even though it requires low graphics, and indeed it plays really smooth on my laptop (4 GB RAM, 1,8 Ghz), it can heat quite a bit, so you might want to consider taking a break between plays. This shouldn't stop you from having fun!  Some tips for first players like me: 1 - I read that in order to sleep, you need to build an 'item', but I died before getting a chance to sleep, so... lol; 2 - Don't to too far before collecting essential items. It seems that the further you travel, the bigger the chance to find a monster and some advanced, but initially useless items.

I **had** to leave a review after I noticed:  The devs, sometime ago, finally fixed lag/connection lag and frame lag in multiplayer! YES! THANK YOU!  When I tried to play this game sometime last year, it was so choppy in framerate that it was barely an enjoyable experience. I decided, with the Spring Cleaning event on Steam, to try and give this game another go. Lo and behold, the menu/loading screen doesn't lag now because a lot of the unnecessary menu and loading screen animations were removed. Also, the game itself runs SOOOO much smoother now. I have a craptop and this game runs fine on it!   10/10 would get destroyed by wolves with rest of server on day 8 again.

Never got hooked on heroin? Fret not. DST is an excellEent substitute, minus the unholy withdrawal effects.   First off, this game is minimalistic and still ginormous af. Everytime we start off a new server, we barely end up exploring 1/10th of the map. Second, DST is immensly challenging (even with guidefagging) yet satisfying like losing one's virginity (most yall are virgins so this referrence might not be the best). Surviving through the winter is really tough unless you know your poop. And lastly, the atmosphere, music and dev's sense of humor is tight af  (Red butts xD ). A true survival game through and through, no complaints from me or me friends after 10 hrs of playing it except 'WHY DA FOCK IS THIS GAME SO 'ARD!?!"  Props Klei, it was a real treat shooting up this batch.

Don't Starve Together is a Co-Op (or singleplayer) Survival (Horror/Cartoon) game entirely based around the theme of being dropped somewhere in the wilderness and having to survive on the environment around you. It uses the theme of "horror" well by incorporating it into the gameplay using insanity and the use of fire at nighttime, while the cartoon element takes out some of the "horror" aspect to make it much more spooky and playable for a larger player-base. That being said, the gameplay is really quite fun and fast-paced, making it so that you have to think about what you want to do next given that you only have so much time in each day. Each playable character has different perks, making each new world a new game and challenge for you to play. Especially fun with friends! I highly recommend getting this game! Plus you get a copy to give a friend--who needs a sale!

I cannot recommend this game enough to anyone who is currently on the fence about buying it. After having spent close to 300 hours playing this game, I have yet to become bored with the gameplay, due in part to the wonderful job Klei is doing with special events, as well as the mods made by fellow players.  If you have enjoyed Don't Starve, you will highly enjoy this game, as it expands on the content found in the first game. If you haven't played Don't Starve, well, I really don't know what to say. Just go play it, then come back here. Now on to the things I really like. First, the art style. This game does an amazing job of making everything look whimsical, yet still somewhat threatening. Second, the game does not hold your hand or tell you what you should do next, nor does it explictly say what creatures will kill you. Third, this game can be brutal. If you and your friends die with no way to resurect, than that's it. You will have to start over in a new world from scratch. Can it be frustrating and rage inducing at times? Yes. Will you find yourself dying due to stupid mistakes? Yes. But over time and with enough patience, you will learn from your mistakes and become a better player due to your failures. Trust me, it feels really good to finally kill a boss after dying from it several times and being forced to start from scratch again and again. Furthermore, Klei has done a tremendous job of adding updates to the game to keep it fun, i.e The Forge. Overall, this is an amazing game, and I highly recomend it to anyone who likes survival/crafting games, or is simply looking for a challenge.  Nominated for the Steam Awards

This is a very great game, I would reccromend to play with family and friends (that is if you have any).  A terrific game that allows easy to find mods to install that make the game easier, harder, more chalenging, or more cheaty.  Whatever you want.  Now I must say the artwork is absolutely fan-flippin-tastic.  Love the fact that the characters' voices are replaced with instrument sounds instead of real voices.  The gameplay is fun, learning how to do specifc things and discovering new things constantly as well with enemies and tools and crafts.  Not to mention how interesting it is how the characters all ended up in the area.  I rate the game 9/10.  Only thing missing that would make the game more challenging and difficult, as well as harder than focusing on food, would be adding a water meter.  Would pay for a DLC adding that.

This game is the best. The morbid but charming animations and dialogue make all of the characters and NPC's lovable. Meanwhile, the game offers seemingly infinite different approaches to take in order to survive, with so many subtle mechanics that you could spend months just learning about all there is to do in-game.   The unlockables are great, with playtime rewarded with random drops of varying rarity, and special items that come around with each new seasonal event. I love this game and would recommend it to anyone, but especially to those who are looking for a solid, enjoyable multiplayer game to share with friends.   It doesn't hurt that you get a free copy of the game to gift to a friend, just make sure you pick a friend that'll actually use it. Learn from my mistakes. Hahaha

This game is worth the money. Your getting 2 copies of an amazing quality game, which means that you could get one copy for $7.49 USD which is an amazing price.   Don't Starve Together is a really great expansion on the original Don't Starve, but manages to still be amazing even when it has some tiny sacrifices to make this game multiplayer. This game runs really smooth, and handles very well. The controls are easy to get used to which makes this a great game if you want to play it non stop. This game also generates a completely different world every time you get bored of your other worlds, and can be customized, so that only your friends can join, or can be a fully public server.  I can proudly say that I recommend this game to anyone who wished to give this game a go. 10/10

I've owned this game for years and have pumped over 100 hours into DST and the singleplayer and still haven't reviewed it, for shame.  Highly recommended, I'll sing this games praises whenever I get the chance. It's provided hours of entertainment, solo and with friends. The first time I became totally self sustainable I was so pleased with myself, and then promptly died to Deerclops (beware winter!). I'm not sure what it is about Don't Starve, but I find myself itching to play it every few weeks and then will end u playing it for two days and barely doing anything else. It's been a favorite passtime for me and a couple friends in recent months, cooperating and getting each other killed has been a riot.  Friendly enough for beginners without holding a veterans hand and putting the kiddiemitts on, I recommend this for anyone looking for a good game that they can leave and come back to, or play for hours on end.

It's a great survival game. Mods are great fo fix quality of life things that klei dont want to change (which is fine). The only thing I have noticed that bugs me a bit after 250 hrs is that certain characters are much better than others. I feel like a little tweaking has been in order for a while now. Other than that I was very happy with all of the regular updates to the game and the Forge was a lot of fun.  Update: For people with questions about this game in 2019. It is a great time to give this game a try if you've been on the fence about it. Klei's road map for DST in 2019 is very promising. New characters and re-works for current characters that need it are finally coming. Klei has also promised new content outside of characters and character changes. New biomes are set to come out a little later this year.   Why start now if the content isn't out yet? DST has a decent learning curve and getting an early start should put you in a good place to be comfortable with the game as the content drops month by month.

If you love Don't Starve, and have 5 friends that also love Don't Starve. Then I highly recommend playing Don't Starve Together. It's a great way to see how well your friends and yourself will last together. With more people come more challenges as food is scarce and resources can be hard to gather. Like normal Don't Starve, you are able to adjust the worlds to better suit your needs.  Beware as Giants roam the lands, and caves hold unknown terrors.  The only issue with Don't Starve Together is the fact that Caves require their own server, meaning that whoever is hosting has to have an ok PC to host both the above ground and Caves servers. Also having a strong internet connection is recommended if you have more than 3 people on at a time.  The story essentially takes place after Winston beats Maxwell and assumes the chair, though that is really a minor detail. It's yet to add Shipwreck, though Klei has been slowly adding all of the DLCs from Don't Starve into it.

This is one of my favorite games of all time.  Few games match the charm and lovely, whimsical appeal of Don't Starve. But, visual uniqueness aside, Don't Starve is a deceptively deep survival game. You will likely die many times, but after each death you learn something new, and you will take that knowledge with you into the next world. Eventually, there will come a point where you have such a thorough understanding of the many different gameplay elements of the game that death will seem like some distant memory.   Indeed, once you've established a consistent means of obtaining food, and have fortified your base heavily enough, there will be little to threaten your survival. At which point, the game will evolve and you'll be able to enjoy the deeper layers of crafting and the challenges of obtaining that unique new item or weapon. And, if you've reached a point, like me, where you seem to have obtained everything you will ever need... And have no threats to your survival... You can just play the game in your off time to relax. There is something reallly therapeutic about this game.   From the moment I started playing the single player game, 'Don't Starve', I was hooked. I played that for hours and hours, and was reluctant to dive into 'Don't Starve Together' as I had assumed it was a multiplayer focused game, intended only for those that played with others. But I am here to tell you, I was wrong.  By all means, it's a fantastic game to play with friends. I played with my brother for a short while and I have to say, I enjoyed it a lot. The challenge of survival, of needing to obtain enough food to survive the night, was heightened with two mouths needing to be fed. However, just like in the original Don't Starve, this game is a joy to play alone, too.  So, please don't let the title fool you. Sure, it's a fantastic multiplayer game. But I have played many, many hours and am still living on the first world I created - day 400 something. All by myself.  What's more, the developers clearly have a great passion for this unique world they have created. They continually update the game, and have begun implementing entire new game modes to allow players to experience a whole new aspect of 'Don't Starve'. The Forge was an absolute blast and I eagerly await its return, and the arrival of new multiplayer experiences.  So, please, do yourself a favour. If you enjoy survival games, you owe it to yourself to check out Don't Starve.

A wonderful survival simulator that becomes exceptional when played with friends. It's open to mod support (but this can make the game unstable) which allows for even more end game content. While none of the systems are terribly deep, there's a lot here to keep you busy for 10's of hours. I've seen most of what the game has to offer in my 66 hours of co-op fun, but a close friend of mine has 500+ hours in the game. Want to get lost in the woods, cut down trees, mine rocks, build a base, plant a garden, and explore some caves with a friend in a charming and challenging world? This is your ticket.

I think it's worth your money, if you have a few friends that are down to play with you then definitely buy it, even if you get bored after a while you'll want to play again, this game has its own charm.
